body.p:
To his Excellency The Honorable Beriah McGoffin Governor of the state of Kentucky Your petitioner William M Bowman humbly complaining would most respectfully represent and state to your excellency that at the last August Term of the Marion Circuit Court he was fined the Sum of fifty dollars for carrying concealed a deadly weapon, he would further state that he is poor and in a needy circumstances and is entirely unable to pay the same he is married and has a family dependent upon his labor for support and the fine which if not paid in a short time he is informed by authority he will be taken to Jail, he therefore in consideration of the facts above represented and hardnests of the times humbly supplicates your Excellencys interposition in his behalf and that you will grant a remysion of the fine, Entreating I remain your most Obedient and humble Servant
Sept 11th 1861
Sworn to before me this 12th day of Sept 1861
L. H. Noble P. J. M. C. C.

We the undersigned believe the statements
above to be true
